sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Seizure Smart School Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Seizure Smart School Act.

sections.heading: Findings.   The General Assembly finds all of the following:
sections.text: Findings. The General Assembly finds all of the following:

sections.heading: Training for school employees and delegated care aides.
sections.text: Training for school employees and delegated care aides.

sections.heading: Self-management.  In accordance with his or her seizure action plan, a student must be permitted to possess on his or her person, at all times, the supplies, equipment, and medication necessary to treat epilepsy
sections.text: Self-management. In accordance with his or her seizure action plan, a student must be permitted to possess on his or her person, at all times, the supplies, equipment, and medication necessary to treat epilepsy.

sections.heading: Restricting access to school prohibited
sections.text: A school district may not restrict the assignment of a student with epilepsy to a particular school on the basis that the school does not have a full-time school nurse, and a school may not deny a student access to the school or any school-related activity

sections.heading: Protection against retaliation
sections.text: A school employee may not be subject to any penalty, sanction, reprimand, discharge, demotion, denial of a promotion, withdrawal of benefits, or other disciplinary action for choosing not to volunteer to serve as a delegated care aide.

sections.heading: Federal law.  Nothing in this Act limits any rights available under federal law.
sections.text: Federal law. Nothing in this Act limits any rights available under federal law.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect July 1, 2020.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect July 1, 2020.
